foot-and-mouth: Isolate affected animals. Provide supportive care and topical antiseptic for lesions. If bacterial secondary infection suspected: Oxytetracycline 5 mg/kg IM once daily for 3–5 days (example: '5 mg/kg' is recognized). Consult your veterinarian for exact dosing and withdrawal periods.
lumpy: Supportive care, anti-inflammatory (e.g., meloxicam as per vet), and wound management where present. If secondary infection: oxytetracycline 5 mg/kg IM once daily. Veterinary confirmation required.
healthy: No treatment required. Continue routine monitoring and vaccination schedule.
